p: The EO yield of dried M. frivaldszkyana in this study (0.18% from Uzana and 0.26% from Shipka) was comparable to the one in previous reports. Overall, the EO yield in other Micromeria species was found to vary significantly, from around 0.05 up to 4% [ 15]. For example, the EO yields in M. cristata ssp. phrygia collected from three sites in Turkey were 0.03â€“0.08% [ 15], the oil content of M. cristata and M. juliana collected in Serbia and Montenegro was 0.1% [ 10], and the EO content of M. fruticosa from Israel was 0.5 to 0.72% [ 13].
